snippet: The deal to sell the ships, designed to transport troops, tanks and helicopters, ran into opposition after Russia annexed the Crimean Peninsula in March.
abstract: France's Defense Min Jean-Yves Le Drian asserts that two warships France agreed to sell Russia may never be delivered; $1.5 million deal was criticized by the West after Russian intervention in Ukraine.
lead_paragraph: The deal to sell the ships, designed to transport troops, tanks and helicopters, ran into opposition after Russia annexed the Crimean Peninsula in March.

headline.main: French Defense Minister Says Russia May Never Receive Mistral Warships
headline.print_headline: France: Warships May Never Be Delivered to Russia

keywords.value: Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe
keywords.name: organizations
